title: Business Live: Apple unveils latest products - BBC News

documents.title: wall street eases lower
text: wall street stocks dipped as a fall in apple 's shares partly offset gains in energy and financial stocks , which have been some of the market 's worst-performing sectors so far this year .
apple shares fell 1 % despite the iphone maker unveiling new products and services at its annual developers conference .
energy stocks rose despite a decline in oil prices , down on concerns that saudi arabia and other countries are cutting off ties with qatar .
the dow jones ended the day 0.1 % lower at 21,184 points , while the s & p 500 lost 0.12 % to 2,436 .
the nasdaq fell 0.16 % to 6,295.7 .

documents.title: the ban bites
text: a qatari businessman explains the impact of six countries cutting ties with doha on his work and private life .

documents.title: apple 's homekit hopes
text: another observation from ccs insight 's ben wood :
there is a clear correlation between amazon echo & smart home adoption .
apple clearly betting homepod will drive homekit adoption .
# wwdc17

documents.title: super siri ?
text: apple will also make siri more aware of context , enabling it to recommend and remind users more accurately based on how they use their device .
the digital assistant will better understand follow-up questions and scheduling as well as handle language translation for the first time .
the features more closely rival amazon 's alexa and google 's assistant - two virtual assistants that have become increasingly popular and powerful in recent months .
apple also announced a new software kit called arkit , which will enable app developers to build augmented reality apps on apple 's platforms more easily .
augmented reality is a mixture of live images with virtual animations and objects placed over them .

documents.title: another reinvention ?
text: apple says it wanted to `` reinvent home music '' and thus came up with the homepod - though for once it is playing catch-up with rivals such as amazon and google .
powered by apple 's smart assistant siri , the device can play music as well as answer queries and control other smart home appliances .
the homepod will use its six microphones to up voice commands and uses the same processor chip as the iphone to pump out `` spatially aware '' sound , apple said .
the device goes on sale in december in the us , uk and australia .

documents.title: smart move
text: ccs insight analyst ben wood tweets :
little surprise apple has launched smart speaker .
it ca n't afford to yield valuable real-estate in the heart of people 's homes to rivals .
not at that price for nothing different it wo n't , twice the price of an echo and 5 times a dot

documents.title: hello homepod
text: it looks like apple has taken a leaf out of amazon 's book and released the homepod - a home speaker akin to the echo .
it will be `` just under seven inches '' high and be available later this year for $ 349 .
90 % of my alexa use is music , so i can see how this makes sense .
do that task really well and it might be a winner .
# wwdc17
at $ 350 they 've got to be kidding vrs $ 199 for an echo ? ?
the dot is a cheap way to my hifi & a it all links to my smart stuff .
# tooexoensive
keep the assistant in the pocket with the decent mic and less background noise .
let the speaker take the space for a solid audio output !
this is apple 's new smart speaker .
called homepod .
7in tall .
# wwdc17
crikey it 's enormous ! !
hope my grandmother does n't get to it first she will leave her knitting needles in it
and can it do anything that the others ca n't ? ?
we 've got millions of them , recycle those trash can !
the only things i ask alexa : - what time is it - what 's the weather outside - unit conversions like many teaspoons in 1/3 cup
looks a bit boring to be honest .
will probably do well though , just because it is by apple .
it will not be available in uk as will allow secure messaging @ twitterid will ban it !
looks like the bullring centre in birmingham !
trashcans are the new apple design core .
you just know hifi buffs are gong to hate this .
first smart speaker on the stage today sorry , could n't resist .
want one

documents.title: new ipad pro
text: dave lee says apple has also revealed a new ipad pro , with a 10.5 inch screen that will be available from next week .
meanwhile , ios11 will be a free download available later this year , tim cook says .
nothing revolutionary here , but ios11 on ipad looks very powerful .
a work machine .
# wwdc17
we 've finally managed to achieve a file system

documents.title: app store makeover
text: more from wwdc :
apple redesigning the app store .
long overdue .
more magazine feel .

documents.title: more bumps in the road for uber - and lyft
text: san francisco 's city attorney has issued subpoenas to `` taxi '' firms uber and lyft for records of driving practices , access for disabled passengers and whether certain neighborhoods are underserved .
the city and uber are already also engaged in a legal fight over san francisco 's demands for drivers ' names and addresses and comes at a time when uber is beset by a host of other legal problems .
city attorney dennis herrera said the subpoenas sought four years of records from the companies , which are based in san francisco and have some 45,000 drivers between them in the city .

documents.title: black is black
text: financial times reporter hannah kuchler is also at apple 's wwdc event :
benedict evans adds :
`` do not disturb while driving '' will save lives .
except nobody will turn it on .
it 's automatic
that 's better than i expected ( i did n't hear them say that ) but i fully anticipate that bypass being used basically all the time .
and auto-responding to messages while driving will save relationships .
wo n't this kill competitors like uber/lyft for drivers , google maps , and waze that rely on notifying drivers ?
i 'm sure it 'll be togglableright ?
i presume so
more or less than self-driving cars ?
probably will be the one thing apple does that improves the most lives
unless someone actually reads that little message in tiny letters
as long as it 's harder to reactive than waze
oh yes !
urgent : my dog just farted .
lol
iphone gets a new blank black user interface for while you 're driving

documents.title: imessage payments
text: potentially quite a significant move for mobile payments :
apple introducing person-to-person payments within imessage .
poor venmo .
but would n't that just be idevice to idevice ?

documents.title: fitness , not luxury
text: north america technology reporter dave lee is also watching the apple keynote :
update 2 : apple watch .
still wont say how many sold .
they 've long given up on this being a luxury product .
all about fitness now .
apple watch will integrate with popular gym machines - technogym , that kinda thing .
share data about your workout .

documents.title: siri gets a face
text: more from apple 's wwdc conference .
tim cook has also revealed a `` siri face '' for the apple watch that will enable the voice-activated assistant to give users information such as commute times for upcoming appointments .
the face for siri is a bid to help it compete against amazon 's alexa and the google assistant helper .
while the assistant was previously available on the apple watch , siri only had a limited ability to automatically show information .
apple is also reportedly working on a home speaker powered by siri that could be unveiled during the conference , which runs until 9 june .

documents.title: breakingamazon comes to apple
text: apple chief executive tim cook told the wwdc event in san francisco that amazon prime video would be available on apple tv and other apple devices later this year .
apple has about 50 media partners that supply content to its apple tv and on the television app on iphones and ipads .
however , amazon 's service , which includes hit shows like transparent and american gods ( has been a notable absence .

documents.title: ba 'will recover '
text: iag chief willie walsh again apologised to ba customers and admitted the incident had damaged the british airways brand , but that the airline would recover .
`` this is something i would n't wish on anybody , '' he said .
`` when you see customers who suffered , you would n't want it to happen to any airline or any business . ''

documents.title: walsh : 'difficult to understand '
text: more from willie walsh in cancun , who has effectively confirmed that the ba computer chaos which left 75,000 people stranded over the bank holiday weekend was caused by human error .
the iag boss said the incident occurred when an electrical engineer disconnected the uninterruptible power supply , therefore shutting down the data centre .
that would not have been a big problem in itself , he said , but the damage was caused when the power was restored in an uncontrolled fashion .
`` it 's very clear to me that you can make a mistake in disconnecting the power , '' mr walsh said .
`` it 's difficult for me to understand how to make a mistake in reconnecting the power . ''

documents.title: on the fence
text: diplomatic editor james landale tweets :
fco sits on fence over qatar : `` we hope that a resolution can be found soon & that gcc unity will be restored '' # diplomacy
your radio 4 interview was embarrassing .
you ca n't tell the difference between qatar & kuwait .
journalism has gone down hill in u.k .

documents.title: lagarde 's greece solution
text: imf chief christine lagarde has offered greece 's european creditors a way out of their impasse over athens ' debts that would allow the eurozone to release some funds later this month .
the imf believes greece needs a debt haircut , which germany rejects .
ms lagarde suggested agreeing a deal whereby the imf would stay on board in the bailout , as berlin wants , but not pay out further aid until debt relief measures are clarified .
`` there can therefore be a programme in which the disbursement only takes place when the debt measures have been clearly outlined by the creditors , '' she told german newspaper handelsblatt .
the compromise could allow eurozone finance ministers to give the go-ahead for their next payment of their tranche of aid at their meeting on 15 june , handelsblatt said .
`` it is a possibility for an agreement , '' ms lagarde said .

documents.title: computer says no
text: apple 's annual worldwide developers conference starts in san francisco very shortly .
it 's expected to reveal updates to its major platforms , such as ios and siri , and maybe some new hardware as well .
the shindig is being livestreamed - but only if you 're using an approved device or browser , unlike this one ( chrome , of course ) :

documents.title: breakingba to probe it disaster
text: iag chief executive willie walsh said british airways has commissioned an independent study to examine the computer problems that disrupted its operations the weekend before last .

`` we have commissioned an independent company to conduct full investigation , it will be peer reviewed and we will be happy to disclose details , '' he told the iata annual conference in cancun on monday .

documents.title: flower power
text: the airbus a380 is my favourite plane - even in cattle class ( here at business live towers no one turns left i 'm afraid ) - but many airlines have fallen out of love with the superjumbo .
airbus plans to cut production to one plane a month and has plans to make even fewer if sales do not rise .
however , the plane maker 's sales chief john leahy told the iata meeting in cancun he saw a future for the world 's largest airliner as air traffic continues to double every 15 years .
but then again he would say that .
the a380 above has been turned into a floral installation , in case you 're wondering

documents.title: qatar riddle for us
text: this content only works in the uk .
peter salisbury , senior research fellow with chatham house 's middle east and north africa programme , has been talking to susannah streeter on bbc world business report .
the us has major investments in qatar .
exxon mobil has a huge gas project , one of the biggest gas export projects in the world and the former ceo is rex tillerson , now secretary for state in the us .
this is the first major foreign policy crisis to test this administration .
they will struggle to work out a solution to this .
what this looks like from the saudi and emirati side is a real push to a side .
i do think we will see further reciprocal measures in this trade war .
qatar imports 90 % of its food and there are reports of food stockpiling .
as this squeezes qatar who knows what the response will be . ''
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: ftse falters
text: the ftse 100 has slipped 0.3 % , or almost 24 points , to 7,523 points amid uncertainty about the outcome of the election .
one of the biggest fallers was madame tussauds and london eye owner merlin entertainments , which slipped 2.3 % , while easyjet fell 3.1 % in the wake of the london terror attack .

documents.title: breakingnew c4 chief
text: alex mahon is the first female chief executive of channel 4 .
she has been running foundry , the visual effects and virtual reality firm , and was previously boss of indie producer shine group until 2015 .

charles gurassa , channel 4 chair , said : `` she brings an impressive combination of relevant experience and is brilliantly placed to help steer channel 4 through the competitive challenges and opportunities ahead . ''
ms mahon said : `` there is nowhere in the world like channel 4 and , in these changing times , its mission is more important than ever . ''
she will start in the autumn , succeeding david abraham , who announced his intention to step down in march .

documents.title: a350 back on track
text: aviation watchers will know that deliveries of airbus a350 widebody jets have been held up by delays with the cabin equipment supplied by zodiac aerospace .
however , deliveries are getting closer to their scheduled dates , says pekka vauramo , chief executive of finnair .
`` recently they 've been fairly good .
we just got one two days ago , our ninth , and it was shipped within one or two days of when it was supposed to be , '' he said on the sidelines of an iata meeting in the mexican resort of cancun .
finnair was the first european operator of the a350 and is due to receive two more this year , taking its total to 11 .
the carrier expects to have 19 by 2023 .

documents.title: breakinggoogle shares hit $ 1,000
text: it 's google 's turn to reach the milestone .
shares in the firm 's parent company , alphabet , have reached $ 1,000 for the first time , just days after amazon achieved the same feat .
google listed on the new york stock exchange for just over $ 50 back in 2004 , with a youthful larry page ( centre , signing his name ) there to ring the bell .
in case you 're wondering , that 's an increase of 1,900 % in less than 13 years .
alphabet is now valued at a whopping $ 694bn - bigger than the gdp of saudi arabia , argentina and sweden to name a few .

documents.title: airline profits to soar
text: global airlines are set to post higher profits this year as the world economy enjoys strong growth , boosting demand for air travel .
the international air transport association ( iata ) , which represents more than 200 carriers , said profits should total $ 31.4bn this year , $ 1.6bn higher than its previous forecast .
iata 's forecast for 2017 industry revenues was also raised by $ 7bn to $ 743bn .

documents.title: us mobile test case
text: more supreme court action today : it has agreed to hear a major case that will determine whether american police need warrants to access mobile phone location information kept by mobile networks .

the justices agreed to hear an appeal brought by a man who was arrested in 2011 as part of an investigation into a string of armed robberies at radio shack and t-mobile stores in the detroit area over the preceding months .
police helped establish that the man , timothy carpenter , was near the scene of the crimes by securing data that tracked the location of his phone from his network operator .

documents.title: take your
text: restaurant chain comptoir libanais - best known for its lebanese sharing platters and wraps - has served up a mezze of reasons for a profit warning .

the company blamed `` incremental wage costs and related taxes ( apprenticeship levy ) , higher food and drink costs ( driven by depreciation in sterling versus the euro ) and increases in rent and business rates '' .

in a slightly startling admission , it also said much of the benefit it had reaped over the easter holidays was `` subsequently lost in the final two weeks '' of april , and that its newly opened sites are not doing as well as hoped .
investors are n't digesting the news well .
comptoir 's shares have plunged 28 % on london 's alternative investment market - meaning they 've now dropped 66 % since the firm floated almost a year ago .
author: Dan Macadam
Business reporter

documents.title: supreme court blow to sec
text: the us supreme court has scaled back the securities and exchange commission 's power to recover ill-gotten profits from defendants ' misconduct , handing wall street firms a victory and dealing another blow to the regulator 's enforcement powers .
in a 9-0 ruling , the court found that the sec 's recovery remedy known as `` disgorgement '' is subject to a five-year statute of limitations .

the justices sided with new mexico-based investment adviser charles kokesh , who previously was ordered by a judge to pay $ 2.4m in penalties plus $ 34.9m in disgorgement of illegal profits after the sec sued him .

documents.title: wonder woman wows
text: wonder woman took just over $ 100m ( £ 78m ) in north america this weekend - the biggest domestic debut for a female director .
patty jenkins beat the previous record set by sam taylor-johnson for fifty shades of grey , which opened with $ 85.1m in 2015 .
wonder woman , starring israeli actress gal gadot , has received largely positive reviews from film critics .
the flick was also the most popular at the uk box office , taking £ 6.2m over the weekend .
more here .

documents.title: hermes rejects union 's insurance claims
text: drivers at delivery firm hermes are at risk of working without insurance because the firm is `` dodging '' its responsibility , the gmb union has claimed .

it accused hermes of failing to ensure drivers have informed their insurance companies that they are using their vehicle for businesses purposes and has raised its concerns with the association of british insurers .
hermes said it `` categorically refuted '' the allegations and had been in contact with the abi to satisfy their queries .
`` every courier that delivers for hermes is required to have insurance for their vehicles and , where this does not include 'commercial use ' , they are covered by our group scheme .
this is charged for at 55p a day but only for the days that service is provided on behalf of hermes .
hermes does not profit from this , '' the delivery firm said .

documents.title: wall street opens flat
text: us stocks were little changed as trading gets underway for another week in new york .
it seems investors shrugged off the weekend attacks in london , while awaiting a string of economic data .
the dow jones industrial average fell 13 points to 21,193 , the s & p 500 lost 2 points to 2,436.9 , while the nasdaq was flat at 6,305.5 points .

documents.title: 'tighten the rules on self-employment '
text: with just three days until the general election , we 're hearing from business leaders on what they want from the next government .
cleaning firm boss jennifer o'donnell wants tighter rules on employment and self-employment , to stop some firms exploiting loopholes in the law .
author: Election 2017

documents.title: uber to refund users after london attack
text: uber has said that passengers who used the app around the area of the london bridge attack on saturday night will be refunded .
the taxi company was criticised on social media for allowing its prices to rise after the incident , which occurred around 10pm .
uber cancelled surge pricing later that night , which meant that prices went back down to normal .
read more here

documents.title: maldives joins qatar boycott
text: the maldives has become the latest country to cut diplomatic ties with qatar following a coordinated move by saudi arabia , egypt , the united arab emirates and bahrain , who allege that the gulf state is funding terrorism
`` the maldives took the decision because of its firm opposition to activities that encourage terrorism and extremism , '' the government of the tiny indian ocean archipelago nation said .
despite its reputation as a tourist paradise , the largely muslim maldives is struggling with a large number of youths enlisting to fight for islamic state in the middle east .

documents.title: rsa to open luxembourg office because of brexit
text: insurance giant rsa says it will open a new office in luxembourg in response to brexit , following similar moves by aig , fm global and hiscox .
according to the telegraph , the new office will house up to 10 people and be the headquarters for rsa 's existing eu offices in belgium , france , germany , spain and the netherlands .
a spokeswoman said rsa chose luxembourg because of its experienced regulator , strategic location and multi-national expertise .
`` while brexit is not a major issue for rsa , the move allows the sensible reconfiguration of the branch network in light of the uk 's exit from the eu , '' she said .

documents.title: qatar airways offers passengers alternative travel options
text: qatar airways has said that anyone booked on affected flights to and from the kingdom of saudi arabia will be offered alternative travel options , after several arab states cut ties with the gulf state .
for the airline 's full statement click here .

documents.title: japanese company holds 'macho ' competition
text: a japanese company is hoping to attract workers to the country 's understaffed demolition industry through the medium of bulging muscles .

while it may have an unfashionable 1970s ring to it , the nagoya-based crassone company recently held a `` macho '' competition for demolition workers in order to raise public awareness of jobs in the sector , the japan times website reported .

according to the paper , which called the contest `` unprecedented '' , some 68 workers submitted entries , ranging from rippling muscles in front of large wrecking equipment , to one man in a suit doing administrative work on a laptop .
all the entrants were male , although one worker brought his daughter along to pose with him.read more

documents.title: qataris stockpiling food amid crisis ? bbc business presenter tweets
text: reports of people queuing in supermarkets in doha to stockpile food after arab neighbours say they will block transport links .
# qatarcrisis
british citizens in # qatar told by embassy there is no evidence of specific increased risk despite diplomatic crisis # qatarcrisis
fried in the uae can no longer watch al jazeera english and flights stop tomorrow to qatar .
friend even !

documents.title: qatar 's stock market 7.3 % down at close
text: qatar 's stock market has closed 7.3 % lower on after six arab countries including saudi arabia and egypt cut diplomatic ties with qatar , accusing it of destabilising the region .
the diplomatic withdrawal was put into motion by bahrain then saudi arabia early on monday .
the united arab emirates ( uae ) , egypt , yemen and libya then followed .
saudi state news agency spa quoted officials as saying the decision was taken to `` protect its national security from the dangers of terrorism and extremism '' .

documents.title: oil price fluctuates on qatar fears
text: oil prices have jumped , then fallen after a group of arab states cut ties with qatar , the world 's number one producer of liquefied natural gas .
saudi arabia , the united arab emirates , egypt and bahrain closed transport links with qatar , accusing it of supporting extremism and undermining regional stability .
the move pushed brent crude prices up as much as 1 % before paring gains to trade 0.5 % lower at $ 49.70 .
qatar is still one of opec 's smallest oil producers but some fear tension within the cartel could weaken its recent deal to curb production , aimed at supporting prices .
olivier jakob , strategist at petromatrix , told reuters : `` in terms of oil flows it does n't change very much but there is a wider geopolitical impact one needs to consider . ''

documents.title: egyptian billionaire calls for qatar boycott
text: egyptian billionaire naguib sawiris ( has called on egyptian businessmen to withdraw their investments from qatar and stop business dealings with the gulf state , according to reuters .

egypt , saudi arabia , the united arab emirates and bahrain have said they would cut ties with qatar , which they have accused of supporting terrorism and destabilising the region ( see earlier posts ) .

documents.title: ocado shares go into reverse
text: ocado shares have gone into reverse after jumping by as much as 7 % earlier .
they are now down by about 3 % .
it comes after the online grocer said it had forged its first overseas partnership , licensing its software to an unnamed european retailer .

documents.title: banco popular shares dive
text: shares in spain 's banco popular are 12 % lower today , having been down by 18 % earlier on monday , amid fears that a buyer may not be found for the business .
according to media reports , bbva and state-controlled bankia have both pulled out of the running to make an offer for banco popular .
final bids for the bank are supposed to be received this week .
the fall comes despite a letter sent on friday by banco popular 's chairman in which he told executives that the bank was solvent and asked them to remain calm and confident..
banco popular 's shares were sharply lower last week after reports that a senior eu official had warned that a failure to find a buyer would see the bank being wound down under eurozone rules .

documents.title: pound climbs in morning trade
text: after a very slow start a bit more life crept into the markets this morning , with most of the movement coming from the pound .
sterling rose 0.3 % against the dollar - crossing $ 1.29 in the process - and 0.4 % against the euro as the morning went on ; however , that was n't the interesting part .
no , what was really fascinating was what prompted the rebound .

though yougov 's most recent survey suggests that the tories will fall 21 seats short of an overall majority , investors instead appeared to focus on the latest guardian/ism poll giving the conservatives an 11 point lead over labour .

documents.title: lift-off for india 's comms satellite
text: india 's launching its heaviest ever communications satellite on monday , using its most powerful domestically-made rocket .
the gslv mk 111 rocket weighs 640 tonnes , equivalent to 200 asian elephants or five jumbo jets , reports bbc world service .
it 's hoped that in about seven years it 'll be india 's first vehicle to ferry people into space .
the country is seeking to win a bigger share of the global space industry .
three years ago the indian space research organisation sent a spacecraft to mars : it 's now considering missions to jupiter and venus .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: a third of british workers in 'precarious employment '
text: nearly a third of british workers do not have secure employment , the gmb union says .
it found that as many as 10 million people were in precarious employment , for example working in the so-called gig economy , on zero- or short-hours contracts , or in temporary work .

tim roache , the gmb 's general secretary , said : up to 10 million people go to work either not knowing what their hours are , if they 'll be able to pay the bills , or what their long-term prospects are .

`` that 's a sorry state of affairs in the 21st century and a product of government 's failure to tackle bogus self-employment , the use of agency contracts as a business model and point-blank refusal to ban zero-hours contracts . ''
matthew taylor , head of the rsa , is expected to recommend changes to the rights of self-employed workers this month after a government-commissioned review .

documents.title: germany 's springer goes social
text: what 's the use of newspapers in the age of whatsapp ?

that 's a question that one of europe 's largest media companies , axel springer , hopes to answer today as it launches `` shotty '' , a news service aimed at young germans - particularly first time voters .
the publisher of bild and die welt is betting that 18-22 year olds are interested in what 's going on ahead of elections in september , but want their journalism delivered on modern platforms .

with the slogan `` gönn dir info '' ( `` give yourself information '' ) , shotty will deliver stories every day via whatsapp voice messages , images and summaries from springer journalists , who will also answer any questions users may have .
author: Joe Miller
Europe Business Reporter

documents.title: qatar airways suspends flights to saudi arabia
text: given saudi arabia has already said it is going to close its airspace to qatar , this should n't come as a huge surprise , but qatar airways has got in first .
in the latest development in this fast-moving story , it says it is suspending all flights to and from saudi , where it operates nine different routes .
to recap : etihad , emirates and flydubai have all said they 'll stop flights to and from doha , with more expected to follow suit .
author: Simon Atkinson
Asia Business Reporter

documents.title: could encryption be banned ? bbc technology correspondent tweets
text: is it practical to ban encryption ?
read this and decide
it 's not practical to ban encryption .
so it wo n't get banned .
tech campaigners are fighting the wrong battle here .
may campaigning on this issue yesterday was the final straw for me .
you are right , the battle we should fight is actually for corbyn vs may .
what is said in public is posturing the the benefit of an uninformed audience .
has the bbc done a piece on this ?
it would be good to get it more into the mainstream .
ans : no .
all it would do is make us less secure , less productive and less wealthy .
but she 's going to make political capital out of it .
@ twitterid is a politician so the fact that something is both highly inadvisable and impossible wo n't stop her trying to do it .
and the solution is
they 'll just go dark web
it is neither practical , nor ethical to ban it .
nope it will only disadvantage the public in the end , the people they seek to disadvantage will move onto other means of communication .
not finished with the article yet , came across this : `` prop .
os vendors must redesign their os as walled garden [ ] ''
it 's a pity the peripheral issue of encryption is being focussed on by the pm instead of core counter terrorism issues
tl ; dr. no its not .
i 'm connected on an encrypted connection all day to my office .
i do n't think they want it compromised by back doors .
thanks 4 this .
it 's really easy 2 read & shld b known more widely !

documents.title: eurozone business confidence 'remains strong '
text: eurozone business activity remained strong in may , according to an ihs markit survey .
its final composite purchasing managers ' index ( pmi ) for the 19-country bloc was 56.8 in may , unchanged from april 's figure .
anything above 50 marks expansion .
ihs is forecasting gdp growth of 0.7 % for the eurozone in the second quarter , higher than previous forecasts of 0.5 % .

`` the outlook for the eurozone economy seems to be tilting to the upside , and it seems likely that we 'll start to see many forecasters ' expectations for 2017 growth revised higher , '' said chris williamson , chief economist at ihs markit .

documents.title: ftse 100 slips further
text: the ftse 100 has slipped further after a disappointing set of services sector pmi data suggested that the uk economy could undershoot second-quarter growth expectations .
it 's now down 0.3 % at 7,525.99 .

documents.title: why is ocado 's first international deal so important ?
text: ocado 's deal with a regional european retailer will see the unnamed partner pay an up-front fee to use ocado 's smart platform technology , as well as ongoing fees based on the volume of products sold online .
george salmon , an equity analyst at hargreaves lansdown , says this is just what ocado investors have been waiting for .

`` that the whirring equipment in ocado 's distribution centres is a technological wonder has never really been in dispute , but this has n't stopped there being plenty of debate around the group 's potential profitability , '' he adds .
`` it might be ahead of its rivals in terms of service , but the fact is that organic growth alone does n't justify the shares ' premium price to earnings ratio .
the high valuation reflects the potential for the group to licence out its intellectual property to others , which in turn opens up the possibility of raking in chunky royalties year-in-year-out . ''

documents.title: weak services growth drags on all-sector pmiihs markit economist tweets
text: weaker services lead uk all-sector pmi down to 3-month low of 54.5 in may ( 55.9 in apr ) , but surveys still signal stronger gdp growth in q2
q : is brexit destine to achieve in 2-years what austerity policy failed to achieve in 7-years , i.e .
a leaner meaner u.k. plc ?

documents.title: qatar-gulf business deals begin to crumble
text: we do n't get enough saudi arabian football on the business live page
but in the light of the serious rift between qatar and other gulf states , expect more announcements like this .
alahli saudi club
alahli fcen
�� al-ahli announces the termination of the sponsorship contract between the club and qatar airways .
al-ahli announces the termination of the sponsorship contract between the club and qatar airways .
t-shirt al-ahli 2017-2018
where can i buy ?
it 's joking
ya salaaam
الحمدلله احلى خبر بيرجع الاهلي مثل هجر
عشم ابليس
له خمسين سنه ماحقق دوري الا يوم جات القطريه
مره مو وقتك
this is serious !
boycott
ok fine
أفضل خبر سمعته اليوم .
ههههه بني جمال
مية مية نفر
that 'll show em !
good good
gooo ahli
author: Simon Atkinson
Asia Business Reporter

documents.title: trump uk visit 'still on ' despite khan attack
text: karen bradley , secretary of state for culture , media and sport , says that donald trump 's state visit to the uk is still on despite the us president 's criticisms of the london mayor after saturday 's attack .
she tells today : `` we have been working closely with the mayor of london as we have with the mayor of manchester following the manchester attack .
`` the invitation to donald trump has been extended by her majesty the queen and i am not aware that anything has changed . ''
on sunday donald trump tweeted : at least 7 dead and 48 wounded in terror attack and mayor of london says there is 'no reason to be alarmed ! ' ''
mr khan - who had said there was no reason to be alarmed '' by an armed police presence in london that day - said his comments had intentionally been taken out of context .

documents.title: election uncertainty hits services sector in may
text: britain 's services grew more slowly than expected in may as firms put off investment decisions before this week 's general election and higher inflation squeezed household spending , a survey shows .
ihs markit 's purchasing managers ' index ( pmi ) fell to a three-month low of 53.8 from 55.8 in april , as new orders flowed in at the slowest pace since february .
with britain 's economy heavily dependent on services , ihs markit said that overall gdp growth might not hit a forecast 0.5 % in the second quarter after slowing to just 0.2 % in the first .

`` optimism about the year ahead is running below the long-run average , weighed down principally by concerns over brexit , political uncertainty and weaker spending by households , '' chief economist chris williamson said .

documents.title: no surprises in new car figures
text: we expected demand in the new car market to remain negative in may due to the pull-forward to march - which was an all-time record month - resulting from vehicle excise duty reform .
added to this , the general election was always likely to give many pause for thought and affect purchasing patterns in the short term .

although demand has fallen , it 's important to remember that the market remains at a very high level and , with a raft of new models packed with the latest low emission and connected technology coming to market this summer , we expect the market to remain strong over the year .

documents.title: uk services growth hits 3-month lowey item club economist tweets
text: # uk # pmi shows # uk # services activity disappointingly slowing to a 3-month low in may ( down to 53.8 from 55.8 in apr ) .
new business dipped

documents.title: new car registrations fall in may
text: uk new car registrations fell by 8.5 % in may , with buyers holding back ahead of june general election , the society of motor manufacturers and traders ( smmt ) says .
its latest figures show 186,265 cars were registered last month .
meanwhile , alternatively fuelled vehicles rebounded following a fall in april , rising by 46.7 % .
that 's gives the segment a new record market share of 4.4 % .
sales in the year to date have fallen by 0.6 % as the market stabilises , says the smmt , but more than 1.1 million new cars have been registered in the uk since january .

documents.title: ocado shares jump 7 % on new partnership
text: shares in ocado have jumped as much as 7 % after the online grocer ocado agreed a software licencing deal with an unnamed european retailer .

neil wilson , an analyst at etx capital , says : `` the big hope is that this is just the first of many [ international deals ] and that it can use this deal as the basis for more tim steiner says he expects to sign 'multiple deals in the medium term ' . ''
the stock is currently up 5 % in london .

documents.title: emirates suspends flights to qatar
text: dubai-based emirates has become the latest airline to suspend flights to doha - saying it 's cancelling the route `` until further notice '' .
it told the bbc it was acting `` as instructed by the uae government '' .
the move comes after the uae and three other countries cut diplomatic ties with qatar .
a couple of hours ago , abu dhabi 's etihad made a similar announcement .
emirates operates four daily return flights between dubai and doha .
aviation is just one industry being impacted .
author: Simon Atkinson
Asia Business Reporter

documents.title: astrazeneca 's shares little moved by drugs trial results
text: shares in pharmaceuticals giant astrazeneca are little changed after it presented the findings of a breast cancer treatment drug trial .
at 9:00am its shares were down by 0.13 % .

on sunday astrazeneca said women with advanced breast cancer who carry specific genetic mutations experienced double the response rate and delayed disease progression when treated with its lynparza drugc compared with standard chemotherapy .

the trial showed a `` statistically-significant and clinically-meaningful improvement in progression-free survival for patients treated with lynparza compared to treatment with physician 's choice of a standard of care chemotherapy '' , it said .

documents.title: ftse falls
text: after opening higher the ftse 100 has slipped back .
it 's currently down 0.05 % at 7,544.21 .

documents.title: messaging app telegram centrepiece of is social media strategy
text: as we have been reporting this morning , tech firms have reacted angrily to claims they are not doing enough to prevent extremism .
this bbc feature on the messaging platform telegram is a useful primer on what all the fuss is about .
so called islamic state uses the encrypted platform , among others , to spread its message and coordinate its activities without the authorities being able to listen in .

documents.title: pound stabilises
text: the pound has made an impressive recovery in early trading after a torrid weekend .
it is currently 0.09 % lower against the dollar at $ 1.28790 .
`` after an initial dip when asian markets opened , fx traders have brushed off yet another terror attack on the uk , '' says kathleen brooks , an analyst at citiindex .
polls also suggest the conservatives will still win thursday 's general election , despite their lead narrowing , and so the markets `` are not in panic mode '' .

documents.title: why are n't we saving ?
text: the average uk employee would only have enough savings to support themselves for 32 days if they lost their job , legal and general says .
l & g 's richard kateley blames low interest rates which have prompted us to spend rather than save .
he also tells the today programme we need to budget to protect ourselves and ideally have a buffer of a year 's salary in reserve .
however , he says 32 days is an improvement on previous figures , up from 26 days a few years ago .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: who 's flying the flag for the economy ?
text: andy silvester , deputy director of policy at the institute of directors ( iod ) was also on wake up to money .
ahead of thursday 's general election he was he was asked what the iod made of the parties ' approach to the uk economy .
`` there has n't been a tremendous discussion about business and the economy in the way that there was , for instance , in 2015 .
david cameron and ed miliband fought over the deficit very regularly .

`` in 2017 it 's been the election issue that 's been widely forgotten , so we were expecting more from the manifestos as regards stewardship of the economy at a time when there are some real global headwinds and at a time when business is still having a bit of a tough time , '' he added .
author: Election 2017

documents.title: ftse 100 opens ahead
text: as expected the ftse 100 edged higher at the open on monday .
at 8:12am it was at 7,553.91 , a rise of 6 points or 0.08 % .

documents.title: 'police need greater powers to tackle extremism '
text: after saturday 's terror attack the government said it wanted to get tougher on extremism on the internet .
karen bradley , secretary of state for culture , media and sport , tells today that tech firms need to work with the government to tackle the problem .
she admits there have been cuts to armed police numbers , but says it is not just about numbers but making sure the police have the `` powers they need '' .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: silicon valley reacts to london terror attack
text: silicon valley is both on the offensive and defensive today .

defensive in that they are protecting their reputations as companies that put in a lot of work to stamp out extremist content online , but offensive in making it clear they do not feel kneejerk '' regulation is the way to solve the issue .
the tech industry is mostly in agreement on this .
they believe that end-to-end encryption , while perhaps frustrating to police , is a technology that means everyone 's communications are far more secure .
the logic put forward by experts is that if there 's a way to break into a terrorist 's smartphone without his permission smartphone too .
on monday , apple will be holding its annual developers ' conference in san jose .

i 'm not expecting chief executive tim cook to talk about the issue - he wo n't want to willingly draw his company into the debate - but you can fully expect apple to put its weight behind any movement that seeks to increase security .
and the company will speak out , as it often has , against any attempts from authorities to compel tech firms to give them a so-called back door '' into their systems .
author: Dave Lee
North America technology reporter

documents.title: middle east stocks drop
text: qatar 's stock market has just opened nearly 6 % in the red after four arab countries severed ties with it , accusing it of `` supporting terrorist groups '' including the muslim brotherhood .
the diplomatic spat is the worst in years .
it first flared up in 2014 .
the other gulf co-operation council ( gcc ) countries are n't set to be spared either .
`` all gcc markets will fall today - this is unprecedented and we are entering unknown territory .
this is not good news for the markets , '' a dubai-based portfolio manager said .

documents.title: regulator closes pwc/tesco investigation
text: regulators say they are no longer investigating pwc over its audits of tesco 's accounts .
the financial reporting council said there is not a realistic prospect '' that a tribunal would rule against the auditor over its involvement in the supermarket chain 's 2014 accounting scandal .
in 2014 tesco admitted that it had overstated half-year profits by £ 250m , raising questions about whether pwc could have stopped this .
the fpc continues to investigate other accountancy bodies over the affair , however .

documents.title: watchdog closes pwc probetoday business presenter tweets
text: the uk 's accounting watchdog has closed its investigation into pwgc over its auditing of tesco .
the financial reporting council said it was not a realistic prospect that a tribunal would rule against accountancy firm pwc and its associates .
@ frc drops inquiry into @ twitterid over @ twitterid overstated profits affair @ twitterid
@ twitterid might be more interested !
thank goodness .
all those folks can now move on to even better jobs disgraceful !
is the frc boss an ex pwc or other consultancy worker as usual # conflictofinterest
so what is the point of auditors !
this is a clique looking after its own .

documents.title: venzuela 'hunger bonds ' scandal rumbles on
text: goldman sachs has faced criticism for buying $ 2.8bn worth of bonds from venezuela 's crisis-torn government in may , a move opposition leaders say has propped up the country 's dictatorial regime '' .

daniel gallas , the bbc 's south america business correspondent , says investors buying government bonds is nothing new but nicolás maduro 's government had been running out of money , hence the accusations goldman has thrown it a lifeline .
venezuela 's economy is in turmoil , with food shortages widespread and daily violent protests against mr maduro , who refuses to step down .
goldman says it has done nothing wrong , and the risks of the country defaulting are high .
that said , it bought the bonds at a knockdown price and stands to reap large profits if venezuela is actually able to repay its debts .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: sorrell to face shareholders over pay
text: advertising giant wpp holds its annual general meeting this week and boss martin sorrell 's pay will be in the spotlight ( again ) .
jessica ground of schroders does not expect a vote against his remuneration .
she also notes the firm has taken action , with mr sorrell 's pay falling to £ 48m in 2016 - down from £ 70m .
that said , she thinks his pay is still too high and the firm is likely to make further cuts to prevent the risk of a shareholder rebellion .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: climate change driving discontent ?
text: more from simon howard boss of the uk sustainable investment and finance association , who was on wake up to money .
`` there are a lot of people around the world who are unhappy with the way things are currently set up , '' he said .
`` and it 's not going too far to say that your drivers for that are things like climate change .
it 's been suggested , for instance , that the syrian civil war has been exacerbated by drought .

`` when you factor in things like shortages of resource , poor treatment of stakeholders , it 's quite possible that the existing unsustainable economic structure is generating newer and newer sources of sources of terrorism and instability , so whilst i do n't want to stress the link too much if we build a more sustainable world we may see a reduction in discontent around the world , '' he added
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: toyota pulls the plug on tesla
text: after six years , the partnership between toyota and tesla has run out of power .
toyota bought about 3 % of tesla for $ 50m in 2010 .
but the japanese carmaker announced this past weekend that it sold the last of its stake in tesla at the end of 2016 .
the moves comes as toyota looks to launch its own purely electric car and continues to develop hydrogen fuel cells .
according to reports , there was also a culture clash between the two companies .
toyota shares fell by 2 % on monday to close at 5,968 yen .
tesla shares fell on friday but are still trading near an all-time high having gained nearly 60 % this year .
author: Leisha Chi
Business reporter in Singapore

documents.title: could saudi aramco choose london ?
text: saudi arabia 's state-backed oil giant aramco is close to choosing where it will float its shares , and london is on the cards , says jessica ground , global head of stewardship at schroders .
westerners will for the first time be able to invest in the country 's vast oil wealth and aramco is set to be the world 's biggest company by market cap ( bigger than apple ) when it lists .
however , ms ground tells the bbc there are risks to investing in the cyclical commodities industry and the london stock exchange is likely to demand tough governance oversight to protect investors .
that said , there is some talk of the london stock exchange creating a bespoke arrangement just to get aramco through the door .
having the firm list in london - as opposed to new york - would be a major coup , she adds .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4
